story.Nothing: It was a bright, sunny day in Portvert.
You were just returning from your daily shopping, when you unexpectedly encountered a crowd.
The square of Miria the Great wasn't usually this full, unless an important anouncement was made.
You decide to:

Go have a look.Player: Bianka, hold this for a while, please.

Go have a look.Nothing: You hand your shopping bag to your little sister.
Despite her complains, you throw yourself into the crowd.
After a while, you manage to reach the anouncement wall.

Go have a look.The wall: Members auditions for the order of Masters of Averil
Like last year, the auditions are open for everyone above 16 of age. Those who wish to join the order shall submit their applications until midnight.
Basic training will be provided to those interested and later it will be decided who is worthy of joining our ranks.
Food and a place to stay guaranteed for the duration of the training.

Go have a look.Nothing: When you finished reading the sign, you return to your sister.

Go have a look.Bianka: Did you just really leave me here?

Go have a look.Player: Sorry, I just wanted to read that sign.

Go have a look.Bianka: Well, what was it about then?

Go have a look.Player: The Averils are having member auditions again!

Go have a look.Bianka: Wait, you're 16 now, right? Will you join?

Yes, I want to join.Bianka: Great, go hand them your application!

Hand application.Nothing: A response comes the next day in the morning.
You have been accepted for the tryouts to the Order of Masters of Averil.
Please move in to the dorms bz the end of the week.

I have to think about it.Nothing: You and Bianka returned home with your shopping bags.
You cooked lunch together, waited for your parents to return home, just spent normal day.
In the evening, Bianka asks you again.

I have to think about it.Bianka: Have you decided? Do you wish to join the order?

Yes.Bianka: Great, go hand them your application!

Hand application.Nothing: A response comes the next day in the morning.
You have been accepted for the tryouts to the Order of Masters of Averil.
Please move in to the dorms by the end of the week.

End: You continue to live on with your life
You continue to live on with your life
You continue to live on with your life

story.Nothing: On Friday you finally have all your things packed.

story.Player: Its time to move in to the dorm!

story.Nothing: Your parents help you carry all of your things to the headquarters.
Then they bid you farewell.
Suddenly you|re left alone.

story.Player: I need to find the dorm.

The tavern.Player: People in the tavern are usually more friendlier
Surely there|ll be someone to help me

The tavern.Nothing: With that you enter to the tavern.
Its pretty lively in there, yet you still try to find someone to help you.
You turn around and see a tall man with black hair and blue eyes in front of you

The tavern.Player: Im sorry, sir, I was just trying to find my new dorm.
I thought I'd find someone to help me here.

The tavern.Stranger: Well, you actually found one just now.

The tavern.Tobias: Maybe I'll be your commanding officer

The tavern.Nothing: He smiles and points to a small building.

The tavern.Tobias: That is the dorm. Head there and you'll soon find your room. Your name'll be on the door,
You two, help them with their things.

The office.Player: People in the office are there to help people
I'll find help there for sure

The office.Nothing: When you enter the office, you're met with an empty room
Only one man is sitting at the desk
He's got black hair and when he raises his head, you find out his eyes are a beautiful hue of green

The office.Man: Good morning, what do you need<

The office.Player: Ah, well, I was trying to find my new dorm.
I was wondering, if you could help me find it.

The office.Man: Of course, that's why I'm here.

The office.Nothing: The two of you walk out of the door and head towards a small building
The man, who introduced himself as Tadeas Varren, helps you with your things

The office.Tadeas: You're there for the training, right?
Then we'll see each other soon.
I'll leave your things here, I need to return to the office.

story.Nothing: The next day is the beginning of your training.
You and many other people who have joined the elections are forced out of your beds at six in the morning.
You yawn, as you stand in the crowd waiting for whats to come.
Quiet murmur spreads upon the entire soon-to-be command.
Suddenly a loud whistle wakes everyone up.
You turn around to see two practically identical officers standing at the entrance to the square.
You already know one of them.
Tobias waves at you
You've already met one of them yesterday...but which one?
At first you're really confused, but since you stand close to them, you quickly figure it out.

story.Player: Ah, I get it now. The both have different eye colours!

story.Nothing: Suddenly one of them speaks.

story.Tadeas: Hello everyone. I'm pleased to welcome you all today for the anual Averil tryouts. My name is Tadeas Varren, this is my brother Tobias...

story.Nothing: Tadeas points to the other officer, who smiles and waves at the crowd.

story.Tadeas: ...and we're going to be your commanding officers from now on.
Now, I'm sure you all know we're supposed to train you to become worthy of joining the order, so I won't explain that. Instead, we'll split you into two groups each led by one of us to train in.
The groups were formed based on your age, gender, occupation and previous fight experiences, which we took from the town's chronicle, to make them somewhat balanced.
You can find the group you've been assigned to in your common room in the building behind you. We've also put there the places for your first training session. We'll meet there in fifteen minutes.
I wish you all good luck

story.Nothing: After you've reached the common room, you find out you've been assigned to Tadeas, the more polite looking officer.
How do you feel about it?

Relieved.Nothing: You feel a strong sense of relief.
Tadeas seems more mature than Tobias does, so his lessons will propably be more useful than his brother's.

Disappointed.Nothing: You do not agree with your assignment.
Tobias looked like the more fun brother, you thought you'd enjoy his lessons more.
Despite this, you decide not to complain.
You don't want trouble on the first day of training.

story.Nothing: After reading the board carefully again, you find out you're supposed to start your lesson at the town's outskirts.
There was a little plain next to the border river and that was were your first lesson was to be given.
You quickly take your uniform and head there.
A crowd quickly gathers on the training plain. Tadeas is here as well, patiently waiting for everyone to arrive.
When everyone gathers, he stands in front of his new trainees.

story.Tadeas: Good morning again!
As I said earlier, I'll be your commanding officer from now on.
That means I require absolute obedience from all of you.
who will not listen to my orders will be immediately fired from this program.
Understood?

Yes, sir!.Nothing: You and the rest of your command declare your allegiance to your officer.
He smiles at all of you.

(keep quiet).Nothing: You and few other people do not respond like the rest of the crowd.
Tadeas shots you a glance but says nothing.

story.Nothing: After Tadeas's welcoming speech, the training starts.
Soon your team is seen running around the whole place.
Among the many excercises you're told to do is to climb a nearby wall with your sword as fast as you can.
You quickly figure out a way to attach your sword to you with your belt and are among the first people done.
However, other people aren't as lucky.
You see a girl around your age trying really hard while still holding her sword in hand.

Go help her.Player: I'll go easier for you if you attach it like this.

Go help her.Girl: Thank you! I wouldn't have figured this out.

Go help her.Player: It's fine. We're in the same command, we should help each other, right?

Go help her.Girl: Yeah! Oh, I'm Jenny, by the way. Jenny Kraus.

Go help her.Nothing: You spend the rest of the training together.
After a while, a rest is ordered and the entire command heads to the tavern in town for lunch.
You and Jenny sit together and soon you're joined by someone else.

Go help her.Tadeas: Hey, girls, can I join you?
It's fine, we're just hanging out. You can call me Ted.

Go help her.Nothing: The three of you enjoy your lunch together, until a swarm of muddy human-like creatures joins you in the tavern.
You stare at them in disbelief. Ted next to you sighs.

Go help her.Tadeas: So he really did take them to Tirana.

Go help her.Nothing: Tirana? you think. Isn't that the port town with swamps all around?

Go help her.Tobias: You're damn right I did! If I can do it, they should as well.

Go help her.Nothing: Tobias, seemingly the only clean one from his group suddenly appears next to your table. Tadeas only quietly rolls his eyes.

Go help her.Tobias: Anyway, why are you sitting here? Come join us officers!

Go help her.Tadeas: No, thanks, I'd like to spend some time with my command.

Go help her.Nothing: Tobias eyes you up and down. You feel embarassed under his gaze.

Go help her.Tadeas: Yes. Now if you excuse us, we've got lunch to eat.

Go help her.Nothing: Tobias just raises his eyebrows in disbelief, but then leaves you alone. Recalling your embarassment, you gratefully smile at Ted. He smiles back.

Ignore her.Nothing: This is army, no time for those that can't help themselves, you think.
You finish your training quietly and swiftly and then head to lunch.

story.Nothing: Then the training contines until evening.
when you reach your room, you're as tires as you've never been.
You think about your day.

I've done well.Nothing: You feel proud of yourself for lasting this long.
As long as you'll keep this up, you'll definitely pass the test later.
And with this thought you quickly go to sleep.

I should work harder.Nothing: You think your work wasn't good enough.
When thinking of ways to improve, the thought extra training comes to your mind.
No one really forbade you from going outside, after all.
With that, you quietly take your wooden sword and head to the practice grounds.
After a few practice swings a voice sounds beside you.

I should work harder.Tadeas: Raise it a bit higher, it will work with more force.

I should work harder.Nothing: You turn around to your officer. He's smilling at you.
You smile back. For the next hour Tadeas helps you with your private training.
When you go to sleep, you feel a lot stronger than before. Tadeas's words linger in your mind.

I should work harder.Tadeas: You're a lot stronger than you think.
I'm proud of you for working this hard

story.Nothing: After months of training, you're finally ready to take your entrance exam.
Nervousness spreads through the entire command.
But even though you're nervous, you all are united by one thought: Be better than Tobias's command.
It wasn't hard to notice the way he acted towards Ted, constantly pushing him down and belittleing his achievements.¨
You all really liked your commander - he was kind to you and always explained things in a way you all could understand.
Which is why you all decided to avenge him - you aimed to be the only ones accepted to the order to prove Tadeas was the better instructor.
And then the day of the exam came.
You and Jenny were sitting at the training grounds as people from the committee were building their desks.
You were talking about how likely were you to get accepted.

story.Jenny: Ah, I really can't do this! Why does it have to be swordfighting? I'm teribble at that!

story.Player: Well, unlike me you can at least swing the sword properly!

story.Jenny: Yeah, but I always mess up the tactics!

story.Nothing: Your arguing would go on forever if Tadeas didn't come at that moment.

story.Tadeas: Oh come on, you two, you're not terrible at all.
But since you're so nervous, I'll give you a quick reminder of our lesson.
When in doubt, you can use Miria the Great's feint, remember?
It works like 90 percent of the time and you're both really good at it.
But remember not to use it too often, your opponent would notice the pattern and defeat you easily, alright?

story.Nothing: You and Jenny smile at each other.

other.Nothing: You were helping people from the committee build their desks.
As you were assembling one, you noticed a desk with papers from one of the jury.
It had a chart with grading of various sword fighting moves.
Ranked highest was Miria the Great's feint.

other.Player: Oh, I can work with this.
As long as I use this feint, I can deffinitely pass.

story.Nothing: After a while, the auditions begun.
It was decided to be swordfighting match-off against commands, since there was lower propability you'd know each other's fighting style, but it didn't actually matter who won.
The catch was to show you're better at swordfighting than your opponent.
Pairs of two would stand in front of the committee which would rank them based on their performance.
The best of you would be accepted to the order.
Finally it was your turn.
In front of you was a pale man with sharp black eyes.
The match begins and your opponent starts with a strong swing from left.
You decide to

Swing the same direction.Nothing: As you do this, your opponent's sword hits your hands and your weapon leaps from your hands.
You didn't exactly leave the best impression on the committee.
You pick up your sword again, but the whole fight just continues terribly for you and eventually ends with your defeat.
In the end, you weren't picked to enter the order.

Swing the opposite direction.Nothing: You counter-attack and are able to maintain your posture.
Your opponent raises his hands to strike you from above.

Hit his uncovered body.Nothing: The pale man jumps back trying to dodge you and falls to the ground.

Point the sword at him and demand he giv.Nothing: Your oppponent quickly agrees to your suggestion.

Wait for him to get back up.Nothing: You have missed your best opportunity.
Your opponent quickly finds your weakness and defeats you.
You lose the match and aren't chosen to enter the order.
In the order there is no place for those who wait.

Do Miria the Great's feint.Nothing: You move quickly and are able to get your opponent's sword out of his hand.
It gives you the confidence you needed. Soon you find yourself victorious.

story.Nothing: Later you even find out you've been accepted to the Order.
You and Jenny, who also got in, go out to celebrate.
You spend the whole night chatting in a nearby tavern.
You've got bright future ahead of you with your friends there to support you.
At least for now...

other.Nothing: Soon after the results are out, Tobias aproachs you.

other.Tobias: Guess we can expect many things from you.

story.Nothing: The next day comes. As you move in to your new dorms, you think about your family.
You haven't seen them since the day you got accepted to the program.
You were writing letters to them, but still...
You hoped they were okay.
After you finished packing, you went to the common room to see your tasks for the day.
You found out you were supposed to patrol the area this evening with Tadeas, since novices shouldn't do their duty alone, until they're proven worthy.
With anticipation, you wait for the evening.
When everything goes dark, you wait for Tadeas outside the dorm building.

story.Tadeas: Ready to go?

story.Nothing: You jump surprised at his sudden apperance.
You quickly shake away your shock and the two of you set out on your duty.
Everything goes smoothly until you suddenly hear a familiar voice.
You turn around to see your little sister Bianka running towards you.
She runs towards you and hugs you tightly.

story.Player: Bianka, what are you doing here?

story.Bianka: Mum said, you got accepted to the order so I thought I'd meet you out on patrol eventually.
I kept watch of the order building and when I saw you exiting a while ago I sneaked out to find you.
I would be here a lot quicker, if it wasn't for the earthquake tho.

story.Tadeas: What earthquake?

story.Nothing: You quickly notice the seriousness in your superior's voice.

story.Bianka: Two streets away. You guys didn't hear it? It was reeeealy loud.

story.Tadeas: We should check it out.

story.Nothing: He then bends down to Bianka's level.

story.Tadeas: Could you please lead us there, sunshine?

story.Nothing: The three of you quickly move to the place Bianka mentioned. Though, apart from some empty boxes scattered around, you find nothing suspitious.

story.Player: Are you sure this is the right place?

story.Nothing: Yet Bianka never got to finish her sentence. The earth shook once again and the whole place quickly became a mess.
The earth suddenly became liquid and elektricity was felt in the air.
You'd become part of this mess too if Tadeas didn't pull you away. However...
From safe distance you saw your little sister getting sucked into the liquid ground...
When she disappeared, the place became solid once again.

story.Tadeas: I don't know. Let's tell that to the higher-ups. They'll know what to do.

story.Nothing: You quietly reach the Averil's headquarters. However, when you tell your chief what happened, he just tells you to let that be.

story.Tadeas: What do you mean?

story.Chief: Disapearances like this happen pretty often, they're the reason the order was founded in the first place.
When they happen, we just announce the missing person as a criminal to cover up. Don't worry too much about it.
You can go now. I'll send someone to finish the rest of your patrol.

story.Nothing: And then you're left alone. Tadeas went back to his room saying he had something to think about. And it wasn't like your head was much clearer..
After the incident with Bianka, you couldn't sleep worried about her. What really happened? How could the higher-ups just cover it up?
And it seemed you weren't the only one concerned about this.
Tadeas had gone missing. And Tobias, as his brother, was rightfully concerned about what happened.
You quietly explain the situation to him.

story.Tobias: ...and you just let that happen, you useless...forget it. I'm leaving. There's nothing holding me here now.

Let him go.Nothing: You quietly watch Tobias's back leaving. You wonder if anything would change had you gone with him.

Ask him to take you with him.Player: My sister got lost as well. I want to find her.

Blackmail him.Player: If you won't let me, I'll tell the order you deserted and the direction you went in.
I can also help with anything you want. I can't get out of the town alone.
I can even help you find Ted!

Offer to help.Player: I can also help with anything you want. I can't get out of the town alone.
I can even help you find Ted!

Ask him to take you with him.Tobias: Urrgh, fine, I get it. Pack your things, we're leaving in ten minutes.

Ask him to take you with him.Nothing: In the next hour you're already far from Portvert. You're on your way to Filimia a country full of forests and swamps.
The order certainly won't look for you there, since no one has been able to get through the borders.
But Tobias believes he can and as his sidekick, you have no right to complain.
You reach the border pretty soon. The forest is as dark as night, yet you still dive in.
You're deep in a swamp a minute later.

Ask him to take you with him.Female voice: Oh, who do we have here?

Ask him to take you with him.Nothing: You feel yourself getting pulled from the swamp. In front of you are three pale skinned men and one woman, all of them with white hair and reddish eyes.
For some reason, they share a lot of features wih you.
Your mom told you she was from another country. That had to be Filimia!
You turn around to see Tobi struggling with two other men.

Ask him to take you with him.Female: I'm curious - what is a Filiminian like you doing in a swamp? Shouldn't you know how to get around them? And who is this guy?

Ask him to take you with him.Nothing: You find the woman pretty kind. You tell her your story.

Ask him to take you with him.Tobias: Dude, didn't Ted teach you anything about trusting an unknown individual?

Ask him to take you with him.Female: Well, lucky for you, I know a way to help you. My name is Niagi.

Ask him to take you with him.Niagi: Normally outsiders aren't allowed in, but since you're Filimian, we'll let this pass.
Now, I'll lead you to our ghost. She'll propably know the answer you seek.

Ask him to take you with him.Nothing: Ghost? Aren't those only in legends?
In your world people believe in ghosts as guardians of the gods's will. It's said there is one residing in and guarding each region.
No one has ever seen one though. And now you're going to meet one?
Niagi quickly dances through the swamps. You have hard time folloving her, but finally you arrive at a glade.

Ask him to take you with him.Lilliana: Yes, what do you need from me?

Ask him to take you with him.Nothing: A pale ghost-like figure appears in front of you. It looks just like you had imagined, with one exeption...

Ask him to take you with him.Lilliana: Yes. I was once human, you know? But I was killed yound and since then I'm Filimia's ghost.
What do you want to know?

Ask him to take you with him.Nothing: For the third time that day, you explain your situation.

Ask him to take you with him.Lilliana: I think I know what happened.
Have you head the story of the Library?

Ask him to take you with him.Nothing: YOu nod. The Library is a legendary place built by the gods to study humans. There are even books about every human and their future.

Ask him to take you with him.Lilliana: Well, the gods still reside in the Library, yet they're not satisfied with studying humans just from books. Sometimes they just pull a human dow there as well.
I think that's what happened to your sister.

Ask him to take you with him.Player: So how do we get to the Library?

Ask him to take you with him.Lilliana: That I don't know. But I know about someone that should know.
Go to Laverna and seek a girl named Katrin Spierce. She has long wanted to go to the Library and is just lacking the manpower to do so. She should be in a small town called Daria now.
There's also good swordsmith there so you can buy yourself some weapons.

Ask him to take you with him.Nothing: And with that, the two of you set out on a journey again

story.Nothing: Just as Lilliana told you, you immediately set off to Laverna.
The walk there is in complete silence since both of you have many things to think about.
Finally you reach the town you wanted to go to.

story.Tobias: Let's go, we'll pick you a suitable weapon, since you're that bad with sword.

story.Nothing: You and Tobi enter the shop. Your companion doesn't let you touch anything but picks a beautiful polearm for you.

story.Tobias: This should work better for you.

other.Nothing: Tobias enters the shop alone and haves you wait for him outside.
You don't need a weapon anyway, according to him.

story.Nothing: After you're done shopping, you set out to the market. If there is any place to find this Katrin, its here.
You meaninglessly walk around, until you hear someone mention the Library.
You and Tobias look at each other and then listen in.

story.Female voice: ...and is this girl skilled enough that her inventions would last in the Library?

story.Male voice: Yes, they say so, Miss Katrin. She's a genious apparently.

story.Katrin: Good. Then I'll go meet her. Thank you, Alejandro.

story.Nothing: At this cue Tobias gets out from your disguise.

story.Tobias: Hold on for a moment, Miss Katrin~
Relax, We're here to help you. We heard you're also interested in the Library.
Then we'd like to offer our services. I'm a really good fighter and my companion here...uh...

story.Player: I am really good at orientation! I don't get lost, even underground.

story.Nothing: That wasn't half a lie. You've always had a sharp sense of direction and as Niagi explained to you earlier that day, this sense is shared among every Filimian.

story.Katrin: Oh...and what would you like as a reward for joining us?

story.Tobias: We would just like to enter the Library, nothing more.
We can also offer you a secret base, well sheltered.

story.Katrin: And where would that base be?

story.Tobias: Yes, or at least they can.

story.Katrin: Well, you hear that Alejandro? Looks like we'll have a company now.
Now, before you two stepped out to me, I was on my way to meet another of our future companions.
Come with me. Let's meet them.

story.Nothing: The four of you then find yourselves in an old hotel. Alejandro takes you to the dining room. There you see a little girl and an old man, tough he's not as old as Alejandro.

story.Little girl: COme on, Sean, one more dohnut, pleeeeease-

story.Sean: Ah, sorry. Well you must be Katrin then? And they are-?

story.Nothing: You and Tobias quickly introduce yourselves.

story.Katrin: Well then, since you're both here, I assume you agreed to my offer?

story.Sean: Yeah, we...really need the money and a place to stay. And I'm sure Sasha wouldn't mind helping you if she can get few more dohnuts out of that.

story.Nothing: Katrin and Sean shake hands. And then your group takes off to your new base in Filimia.
And than a few years pass.
Even though you wanted to enter the Library as soon as possible, Katrin wanted to find the most suitable spot.
It turned out there was an entrance near every Averil base, so you had to scout them all.
During the years Niagi taught you everything about being a Filimian, so now you were super knowledgeable about orientation in nature and even all kinds of poisonous flowers.
Tobias taught you how to fight as well, so you considered yourself pretty strong.
You were even known as the Navigator in the underworld.
In front of you was the last base. Because Katrin didn't want anybody to find out your goal, you had to be secretive about it.
So you got into an agreement with another party to rob this base. You were now waiting for them.
You heard someone coming your way. You quickly hide behind a tree. It may the party you're looking for, but better be safe than sorry.

story.Another voice: The most famous thief! I'm sure they'll be able to help us!

story.Voice: And how do you know they won't betray us?

story.Nothing: You quickly hid behind a tree.

story.Another voice: Come on, it'll be easy, Ted. Everything is safe and we'll be loaded after this.

story.Player: Ted...Tadeas?!? Tadeas Varren? Could that be?

story.Nothing: You quickly peek from behind the tree. An unknown person's back is facing you, but behind them...
Tadeas's eyes widen as he sees you behind the tree.

story.Player: Ah, shit, I've been caught...well, time to act natural, I guess.

story.Nothing: As the other person notices Ted staring behind his back and turns around, you seemingly calmly step out from behind the tree.

story.Other person: Well then, I'm Brian and this is Tadeas.

story.Brian: I believe we've agreed on the terms of today's actions, right?

story.Nothing: Clearing the base was easy for you with your new companions. Ted didn't say a word to you, event hough he clearly recognised you.
You even quickly found the entrance to the Library, but it was narrow and not worth using.
After the action was over, Brian was quick to take his money and disappear.
However, Ted didn't.

story.Tadeas: What are you doing here?

None of your business.Player: You left a long time ago? Why should you care now?
And with that you leave a confused Tadeas where he was and return to the base.

None of your business.Nothing: It was time to venture into the depths of the Library.

Saving my sister.Player: I am saving my sister from the hands of gods.

Saving my sister.Nothing: You explain to Ted everything that happened.
He doesn't take long. He immediately agrees to go with you.
When you arrive to the base, you just indroduce him to everyone else as a new companion. Nobody actually minds that - you were in need of another fighter.
Just Tobias eyes his brother up and down, but doesn't say a thing.
And the next day is the time to venture into the depths of the Library

story.Nothing: A young boy stands in front of an old house.

story.Tadeas: What do you mean, mum is a wanted criminal?

story.Officer: It is what it is, kid. She comitted great crimes and is now locked in the deepest part of the prison.

story.Tadeas: Can I see her?

story.Officers: Only the highest ranking officers have access there, sorrz kid.

story.Tadeas: Then'll become one. I'll join the Masters of Averil and then I'll ask mum myself what happened.
She's innocent, you'll see!

story.Nothing: A group of young bozs beats up another, who used to be part of the group.
But then his mother became a criminal...and they turned against him...

story.Tobias: I'll be better than any of you, I swear...
